thread.title: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open
thread.title_full: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open

author: wtopstaff
title: Paire upsets Nishikori to advance to final of Japan Open
text:
By The Associated Press October 10, 2015 3:31 am Benoit Paire of France returns a shot against Nick Kyrgios, of Australia, during their singles quarterfinal match at the Japan Open men’s tennis tournament in Tokyo, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (AP Photo/Eugene Hoshiko) 
TOKYO (AP) — Benoit Paire of France beat defending champion and local favorite Kei Nishikori 1-6, 6-4, 6-2 on Saturday to advance to the final of the Japan Open. 
The unseeded Paire took the second set with a backhand winner to break the second-seeded Nishikori, who was bidding for his third Japan Open title. 
Paire raced out to a 4-1 lead in the third set and broke Nishikori again to close it out, setting up a final against top-seeded Stan Wawrinka. 
French Open winner Wawrinka beat Gilles Muller 6-4, 7-6 (5) to reach his fourth final of the year, taking the match when Muller angled his backhand volley wide in the tie-break. Topics:
